definition: "knife" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 18)/see also 立刀旁[li4 dao1 pang2]/see also 側刀旁|侧刀旁[ce4 dao1 pang2]

sentences.english: Later Sun Bin was framed by Pang Juan and the Prince of Wei had his kneecaps cut out .
sentences.chinese: 后来，孙膑受庞涓陷害，被魏王剜掉了两个膝盖骨。

sentences.english: The coating damage because of transportation installation and others should be repaired timely.
sentences.chinese: 因为运赢装置或其它起因制败的涂层破坏应及时修剜。

sentences.english: Some people even cut pet's ear or claw or had pet's eyes gouged out.
sentences.chinese: 有些人甚至把宠物的耳朵或爪或宠物的眼睛剜了。

sentences.english: Will you gouge out the eyes of these men?
sentences.chinese: 难道你要剜这些人的眼睛么。

sentences.english: Lu Xun hoped that literary critics should do the job of "gouging rotten apples".
sentences.chinese: 鲁迅曾提出希望文艺批评家做“剜烂苹果”的工作。

sentences.english: As for the shortage I suggest your making up the quantity in your future shipment.
sentences.chinese: 至于短重，我提议你们昔先领货时剜上。

sentences.english: Comply with the compatible rule of complement when usingcompliments.
sentences.chinese: 应用答候语时遵照剜语的相容规矩。

sentences.english: Medical have sore eyes, but pluck heartstrings.
sentences.chinese: 医得眼前疮，剜却心头肉。
那些精灵剜去了我的眼睛。

sentences.english: Scoop out the rotten part of the pear.
But that eyebrow eye easily pick of yet is secretly a Wan chaste regal concubine's one eye.
sentences.chinese: 而那眉眼轻挑的却是暗暗剜了德妃一眼。

sentences.english: I could use my sharp and sturdy horns to hook out the intestines of the wolf.
sentences.chinese: 我的角可以剜出狼的肠子。

definition: cut off the flesh as punishment
to throw a glance at/to peer at/Taiwan pr. [jun4]
to open (one's eyes) wide/to stare at/to glare at
to swallow whole (idiom); fig. to apply uncritically
thorn/sting/thrust/to prick/to pierce/to stab/to assassinate/to murder
to stab/to poke/to prod/to nudge/to disclose
to seize/to clutch/to grab firmly and pull
to cast sidelong glances at sb
